args: (The wind howls. Is it the harbinger\nof a coming storm, or...?)
(It is a bold claim to say you will unearth\nthe bedrock of this world and sculpt it as\nyou see fit, Alberius.)
Just how is it you mean to alter the very\nfoundations of our world, human?
By the two of us working together\nto solve this mystery.
And you propose to be of use\nin this endeavor...how, exactly?
I will allow myself to be captured and\ntaken prisoner, and you will follow\nto see where I am taken.
I knew better than to expect much.\nYour plan is nothing more than begging\nhelp from a higher power, same as ever.
I haven't finished explaining. Hear me out.\nThere's a reason to it.
Did it not strike you as odd that soldiers\nare here in the first place?
There are no outposts nearby. No bases.\nWe've never seen one out this far,\nyet suddenly here they are. Why is that?
Mostlike it is a trap to ensnare prisoners.
They release the otherworldly fiends they'd\nsummoned in order to terrorize the village.
And when its denizens turn to them for\nhelp, they swoop up the lot of them as\nminnows swimming into the fisher's net.

We know they're after live captives,
so we can use that to our advantage.
Getting caught on purpose is the fastest
way to learn who is behind all of this.
Whoever it is, they're cagey enough to seal\nthe lips of their men, so we'll likely learn\nmore inside than out.
I admit, it makes a certain sense—yet\nI fail to see how this plan holds anything\nbut danger for you.
You've no guarantees they won't execute\nyou on the spot once they have you.
Then why bother taking people alive at all?\nIf they didn't have good reason not to kill,\nthey wouldn't go through the hassle.
You've also no guarantee that I will\ncome running to your rescue.
On that front, I have no doubt.
Those soldiers were using fiends\nfrenzied by black mana.
The longer this goes on, the greater\ntheir numbers will swell.
And fiends dripping with black mana\noverrunning the land isn't good for this\nworld, right?
Just so. But that still presents no reason\nfor me to aid you when I might just\nsubdue the soldiers by force instead.
Only if you wish to replay past events.\nA dead man cannot tell what he knows,\nand the living have their memories wiped.
But if I learn the truth from the source and\nmake it out alive, it is no longer an issue.
What do you say? Does my plan hold\nat least some merit?
You're quite the talker, aren't you?
(If I ever imagined something would drive\nme to beg a human's aid, it wasn't this.)
(Yet I can't deny his proposal is my—\nno, is OUR most efficient option.)
(Speaking of efficiency, why would the\nperpetrator summon otherworldly fiends?)
(If they wished to use fiends,\nthis world has no shortage of its own.)
(And whence the need to abduct humans?)
Oh... A shame there's not some kind\nof door that permits one to pass through\nwhile bypassing the space between.
This the next sacrifice, is it?\nToss 'em up on the altar.
What are you planning to do with me?!
Tremble with joy, peasant, for you'll soon\nbecome the cornerstone of a great work\nthat will bind the world together as one!
Binding the world as one? That's amazing!\nRight, then. Sacrifice away.
You're...more understanding about this\nthan our usual sacrifices.

What can I say? I've gotten bored of
the monotony of village life, and it
would be an honor to be a part of
something so grand!
But before you do it, I'm dying to know\njust what my life is being used for.\n...Heh. Dying to know. That's good.
What use is knowing when death awaits?
Is it not natural for one selling his life\nto be curious what it is buying?
Surely this ＂great work＂ isn't just rounding\nup people and offing them—unless your\narmy is no more than common brigands.
Silence, fool! Still, I refuse to allow such\na laughable accusation to stand. If you are\nso curious of your life's use, I'll tell you...
We seek to open a gate to another world.\nDoing so, however, requires tremendous\namounts of energy.
You sacrifices serve the noble purpose\nof supplying our vast store of mana.
A gate to another world?! Oh my, this IS\na great work! Er, but what happens once\nyou finally have it open?
As you will not be there to witness its\nopening, there is no need for you to know.
Then I shall tell him. These men look to\nresurrect the Other, who has been sealed\naway in the heart of the other world.
Who goes there?! And how do you—\nAaaaaugh!
To style such fatal idiocy a ＂great work＂\nis the very height of delusion.
I did not wish to hear my suspicions\nconfirmed, but you did well to loosen\ntheir tongues.
How did a dragon find this place?!
By following your delighted sacrifice there.
But...why is a dragon helping a human?
Captain! We must abandon this place!
None who know of our plans may live!

Plus, we're too close to stop now! We've
succeeded in opening rifts to the space
between worlds. All that remains now is to
open the gate!
So the previous rifts have been failed\nattempts at this gate.
I do not fear you, dragon—and in fact,\nyour mana should suffice to open the gate\nand see Lord Morsayati reborn!
I fear we cannot allow that.
The world shall not be permitted to\nfall into chaos once more! Haaaah!
Your altar lies shattered, and I have placed\nthis land's mana back under my control.\nYour doomed plot is undone. It is over.
*cough* Heh heh... Over...?\nNo... This is only the beginning...
My empire's preparations are...nearly\ncomplete. Stopping us...means nothing.
(So they truly seek to awaken the Other.)
(Is that dark history set to repeat itself?)
